attributes.action: Fund the NHS pay deal for all staff on ‘Agenda for Change’ terms and conditions.
attributes.additional_details: Social enterprises are a crucial part of the NHS family, delivering over a billion pounds of services and employing many thousands of staff while reinvesting any profits in communities. The government has yet to provide all the money for staff working at these organisations, treating some staff unequally when they are, of course, just as committed to and passionate about delivering high quality and effective health and care services as any other.
attributes.background: Steve Barclay, the Health Secretary, recently said that he intended to implement the NHS pay deal for ‘all staff’ on NHS ‘Agenda for Change’ terms and conditions. However, he hasn’t yet provided the money for all these staff, leaving some employers and health workers in an impossible position.
